Dropped on your head? I feel sorry for the bussers and runners with whom he shares his tips. They probably don't make much. Not a single refill, even on water.

About what you'd expect from a chain restaurant in a mall. Often a long wait, decent food, average service. I mean, this isn't fine dining, folks.  The hosts and servers are really hit or miss. Our favorite server always chats with us and makes sure to get our order right, whereas a few others don't seem to care.  For a place overcrowded with families and groups, I'd say the restaurant does a good job. We eat here about once every week or two, and we usually go for the salads and sandwiches. The tricolore salad is pretty good (salad on top of a pizza crust). The pizza itself doesn't seem to be anything special. For what it's worth, we've never gotten food poisoning from eating here, even though we eat here very frequently.

I have been called a pizza snob before and well yeah I am. This place not so good in my opinion. I am starting to think its just not my luck with pizza in this state. CPK has all these exotic choices of pizza that you would expect from California. I like the variety but at least get the basics right. The crust is very dry and the top was sort of greasy. You can do the ringer test or the napkin test to see what I mean.  Napkin test: basically blot the pizza with a napkin (brown napkin works best) and look at the amount of oil soaked into the napkin. Should be sort of sparse, no large blobs. Ringer Test(little more abstract): Roll the pizza, narrow end to wider end, as tight as you can, over a napkin or plate (like you are ringing it out). Whatever falls into the plate you judge. Usually a little grease and bits of crumbs. If nothing falls into the plate you did it wrong or performed the test with a rubber pizza. So this CPK had a few blobs on the napkin test and chunks of crumbs and little puddles on the ringer test. Not as bad as pizzahut, so that means its edible.

Dont eat here too often but when I do, its great! Every time I come here I have to have a cup of the tortilla soup! Pretty good service here too. I've been to several locations and this has got to be one of my favorites!

There's nothing to hate and there's nothing to really like. It's better than mall food. I always like to be a bit adventurous so I try to order a different pizza everytime I go. I know most people like the BBQ Chicken, but that's probably my least favorite. The Chipotle chicken is very good with a touch of spicy. I can always count on the hot sauce situated on every table to add more kick to my pizzas. The Thai Crunch salad is probably the most interesting salad on the menu and the lunch portions are just big enough. I cant image what the regular portion looks like.

The food is alright but the smell in the restaurant just wasn't the freshest, it has this heavy grease smells in the air that came from the kitchen. I think the restaurant is in desperate needs for a serious refreshment.

My boyfriend and I went to CPK for dinner tonight for the first time.  We asked if there was a wait for two people and were told 15 - 20 minutes.  So we sat at the bar, where there was no wait.  Throughout the course of our dinner, there were open tables for two people... The food was good - I had the Waldorf Chicken Salad, which was loaded with walnuts, grapes and apples and my boyfriend had the Grilled Chicken Caesar Sandwich on cheese bread. Word of advice: DO NOT order the Raspberry Mojito.  It tasted like red cough syrup and practically made me gag.  Yuck!

ZERO STARS Just about the worst ever. Stopped by for lunch after golf. First off the front door hostess was on the phone and didn't even look up to acknowledge us.  Sat down and orders drinks. When we asked for a vodka the waiter looked at the wine list and said they didn't have any...WOW Ordered a vodka on the rocks with an olive and onion, drink showed up with a lime. Everything went downhill from here. After awhile the same clueless waiter came by and asked if we wanted anything.....what about the drink order?  We then tried to order food. Wanted a club sandwich on wheat bread, he said the didn't have that kind of bread!   WHAT! We then decided on a pizza. Ordered a large to share with green peppers, he said all they had were yellow and red peppers. When the pizza showed up it had green peppers. What's up with this place? Be advised if you go to this place you're in for a real BAD experience.
California pizza was ok but the the service sucked, it took them an hour to give me my food. AND it was a slow day too.
Been back a few times since. Food is still good and service now as well. Still a wait sometimes but seems that the front is run by more mature staff.

My secret to enjoying this place: take-out. Makes my BBQ chicken pizza (no onions) taste 10x better. Complimentary bread and butter when you pick up, too. If I'm feeling extra hungry, I'll get the half caesar salad with chicken.  Park in the Sears lot, and you can be in and out in less than 10 minutes.

Yeah, too expensive for what you get or don't get.  Had high hopes because I haven't been to one in say 10 years.    Very busy place so sit at the bar to save time if you really want to eat here.    I whispered to my wife, "How was the bathroom?" She said, "Yucky."

I happen to like CPK, but I definitely have to be in the mood for it.  The wait time here is often very long, as it's one of the better places around the Hillsdale Mall.  I used to work in the area in 1999, and the waits weren't so bad.  When I lived nearby in 2005, wow did it get worse. I don't actively seek out this place, but it's good for visitors who've never had this style of pizza.  My usual fare: 1/2 chopped salad, 1/2 a pizza, Arnold Palmer.  About $15.  Hey, it's CPK.

Our server must have been having an off day or else she's just totally lame.  She just could NOT get our orders right...  and mostly just C's orders... It took about 3 tries just to get a Roy Rogers, which is just a Coke with Grenadine syrup in it...  1st try C somehow was given a rum and Coke.  The server was so confused by C sending back the drink, C changed her order to a regular, plain ol' Coke.  And what she received was a Diet Coke.  The drink was eventually left at the table as a 'refill' for S, and then FINALLY, C got her drink - a Coke.  Whew! And then there was the food order...  We all got a salad of some variety but it didn't come to us without some sort of issue or other.  For instance, C ordered her miso shrimp salad WITHOUT cilantro...  It came WITH cilantro.  When she asked for another one , instead of the server whisking it away, the server went back to the kitchen to talk to the *chef* and came back to tell us that the *chef* did not put any cilantro in the salad...  Hmmm... Since we could all SEE the cilantro, C practically had to *make* the server take it back for a new one.  To CPK's credit, the new and cilantro-less salad came pretty quickly. I ordered my salad with salad dressing on the side.  My salad arrived without the salad dressing (fine) but I had to ask for salad dressing (she definitely forgot it).  Erg! So even though the service was off, the food was fine.  Not great, but not bad...  it's CPK after all.  We did all agree that the lettuce wraps were tasty.  Oh!  And I do hate it when apps precede your entree by ONLY 2 minutes.  Please!  Give your customers some time to eat apps before the main meal!  Plus, there just wasn't any room on the table...

Food: After we were done making teddy bears we came here for dinner. I was surprised we had to wait to get in here...anyways once seated I ordered the garlic noodles with chicken and my boyfriend ordered the bbq chicken pizza. Our food came out promptly after our sourdough bread, which was ok.The garlic noodles were flavorful and were exactly what I wanted! However I was disappointed with the very small amount of chicken. Seriously I paid an extra $2 almost for like a chicken nugget chopped into 8   boyfriend was satisfied with his pizza also.We also had dessert, the chocolate cake with ice cream which cost alot cheaper than dinner and was also just okay. Price: Overall California Pizza Kitchen is way overpriced. The food is okay but Id rather go to a restaurant outside of a mall to pay $13 for a meal. Service: Service was friendly  Location: Inside Hillsdale Mall Atmosphere: Not bad, can get loud in here

THE ABSOLUTE WORST CPK ON THE FACE OF THIS PLANET! 1st visit to hillsdale cpk, came in with a group of 6 people.  not that busy, got seated, waited at least 5 minutes to get menus, another 5 minutes to get water, another 5 minutes for us to all get up and leave. 2nd visit to hillsdale cpk.  came in with a group of 3.  never got water, never got menus, got up and left after 5 minutes. 3rd visit to hillsdale cpk, came in with my girlfriend, fairly busy.  ordered food.  waitress asked if i wanted my soup before my entree, i answered YES.  a few minutes pass, I see that my food is finally ready.  while it sits and cools and becomes cold, my waitress is joking around with her coworkers, telling them how her day is, and what she wants to shop for next...i finally received my entree after staring at it on the couter for what seemed like forever...i also received my check along with my food (one of my biggest pet peeves).  my mouth did not touch a single item of food before i got my check.  still no sign of my soup.  in the mean time, my waitress is talking to her coworker, laughing and giggling.  i had to get a different waiter to get my soup..which i received AFTER my entree.  granted, my waitress did not recieve a very big tip. 3 strikes.

I love California Pizza kitchen.... When I head to Hillsdale to do a little shopping I always opt for some CPK's. The wait is never too long and I''ve always recieved great service. I've tried several different pizza's and salad's and havenever been dissappointed. My favorite pizza is the barbecue chicken pizza they are very conistent with the flavor and it always hits the spot. it's also a good size and I have leftovers for my lunch the next day.... My kids are also a big fan of their pasta and mac and cheese.. Like I always do... After a day of shopping in Hillsdale I hit this place up for my late lunch early dinner

WHAT HAPPENED? This place used to be "better" I don't think they care- Our pizza was burnt & they sat us (a couple) in a room with tons of kids we could not hear ourselves think. The front area we saw as we left was mostly adults- I have nothing against kids but shouldn't the hostess be sensitive to the seating?? they were not busy except the back room of yelling kids. Anyway the food sucked. This is probably the 10th time we have had a crappy dinner there. The servers honestly could care less- I thought the manager cared but they walked right by our table to cater to the families which is their  bread & better- they will not miss us-this is too sad as I like other CPK's that care about their food & service---- Go across the street to Outback or even the food court is better. Plus they are way too pricey for what you get
Delicious Gourmet Pizza for too much.   I'd rather eat Amicis.

Sorry... I like NY pizzas.... none of this fancy fruity  "California" pizza. Been to this location a few times, wasn't impressed by the wait, the service, nor the pizzas. After looking at the menu and the toppings, it's not pizza anymore, it's toppings on a round flat bread with sauce. Subsequent visits called for ordering pasta. I don't eat CPK anymore.

This place is so yummy. I got the BBQ chicken salad - should have got a half - it was huge and delicious. Fresh veggies and chicken with a great tasting dressing. My friend got a Chipolte chicken pizza - that was excellent. The service was prompt, friendly and the staff knowledgeable. We also got the asian dumpling appetizers and they were something I'd order over and over. Meal came quick, reasonable price and overall a great experience. I am going back to try more selections from the fast menu.

We came here tonight and I've got to say, right off the bat - service is very lacking!  I know, it's a chain and what do you expect, but this was bad.  We walked in and a few people working there just looked at us - no welcome or hello or we'll be right with you.  A woman walked up to the register but didn't acknowledge us, so we asked if we should order there and sit, or just seat ourselves, or what and she said she'd seat us if we could just wait a minute.  Not feeling the aloha here!!  (I realize this ain't a Hawaiian place, but a little aloha is welcome everywhere.) The food was just ok.  I had the sausage, mushroom, and pepperoni pizza on a thin crust.  Very little sausage and the crust was not impressive - it was thin, I'll give it that.  Lois had the roasted veggie salad but ordered it with ranch dressing.  The salad came with the original vinaigrette dressing and ranch on the side, so she sent it back.  When it came back correct she enjoyed it and thought it was quite good.  Kinda expensive for what it is, though. Overall, the layout and look of the place isn't bad.  It's comfortable and not too loud.  Definitely a family friendly place, I think it's geared toward that.  Considering the average food and the subpar service, though, I don't think I'll be going back any time soon.
The menu is getting smaller,  but the patronage is strong.  They must be doing something right.

I really don't get what all the fuss is about the pizza here. I came here the other day with a friend because she was really craving pizza and suggested this place. Having heard all these rave reviews in the past concerning the pizza here, and the fact that they have the word "Pizza" in their name, I figured "Why Not?".  Came in on a Tuesday afternoon and the place was pretty deserted. They were able to seat us right away and a very friendly waiter came to take our orders almost immediately. Neither of us being particular hungry at the time, we opted to share a pizza and ordered the Meat Cravers, consisting of Italian sausage, pepperoni, Canadian bacon, Capicola ham, julienne salami and Mozzarella cheese.  The wait for the food was fairly short and before we knew it, we had a freshly baked pizza served before us. Being efficient, our waiter immediately deduced that we were going to be sharing the pizza and that would we probably need some plates. So before we even needed to ask, he immediately stated that he would also return shortly with some extra places. +1 for the waiter!  Throughout the meal, our waiter made sure to check in with us periodically to see how we were doing and if we needed anything else. While definitely impressed with the service, the food on the other hand left a lot to be desired. Visually, the pizza looked extremely greasy. A hunch further confirmed after taking the first bite. It was like eating grease and not pizza. The problem was only further compounded by the fact that the "Meat Cravers" pizza barely had any meat on it at all! Aside from a few large pepperonis, everything else was rather lacking. I honestly think I find more meat on my Costco pizza than this!  At the end of the meal, in order to wash down the less than appetizing pizza, we decided to share a Apple Crisp. This was definitely the better of the two items that we ordered. The baked apples at the bottom of the dessert was served warm. And when combined with the cold vanilla ice cream on top, it was a melt in your mouth slice of heaven.  While I would definitely give this place a thumbs up for the service, I could not in good conscience recommend this place to anyone looking for a good slice of pizza. Before we left however, the waiter did give us a "mystery" card (basically a coupon) for our return trip in which we could potentially win $100K. But at least get 10% off our next meal. As a disclaimer, he stated that the card would be null and void if we opened it prior to our next visit. Having no desire to ingest anymore nasty pizza in the near future, I opened mine up. Let's just say I didn't win 100K.......

We enjoy the food when it's done right- and mostly it really IS done right :) The waitlist system is a mess, and the staff we've encountered handling the waitlist have been beyond disorganized. Example: We've repeatedly had our names skipped, after waiting LONGER than the stated wait time. So finally, I feel compelled to write a review. * Here's an idea: Hand out alerting monitors during long wait times so guests can browse nearby shops, instead of sitting around & hovering within earshot inside the echoing mall atrium. This isn't rocket science, this isn't even a new technology, and it's been used in restaurants for at least a decade by now. * Here's a simpler idea: Have staff neatly cross-out who's been seated and where they've been seated. Why? Because the CPK staff have said to me: "Oh! Some one took your table." which is ridiculous, b/c 1) the statement addresses the issue of who I should blame, instead of how the CPK staff plan to fix the mistake. * Here's the simplest idea of all: Have the SAME staff person manning & calling out the waitlist names, in order to minimize confusion. Good service and smart management matters. So we'll send our dollars elsewhere. Thank goodness there's plenty of good eating in San Mateo.

Ordered "The Works" pizza today.  It was okay, but I'm not sure if I'm imagining things but the last few times I went to a CPK (both here and Palo Alto-Stanford Shopping Center), I felt the portions were very "measured i.e. skimpier" than before. I'm hoping CPK can get a better rating from me in the future.  I'd not big on "mediocre pizza, salads, etc", but am willing to come in again.  In this economy, and with our sales tax rate going up, it's nice if a restaurant gives you a little more than you expected.   On the up side, the staff is always friendly, smiling and courteous.

Food was great as always. Service was just ok this time. Although very pleasant, our server (or anyone for that matter) didn't check up on us after the food was served. All of us had some type of pasta and we were trying to get anyone's attention for a.side of parmisean cheese. No biggie, but would have been nice to have while the pasta was hot....

Don't get me wrong, I am a fan of CPK food.. This is based on the take-out. I called in at 4pm trying to get a combo platter for a meeting in our office at 5pm. the girl i spoke to over the phone was very nice and did her best to accomodate the last minute call. SO I order, and im ready to give her the CC# and she says that she is unable to take payment over the phone?!? Seriously? SO she goes and gets her "manager" to see if he can override the transaction. he (his name is Ivan) gets on the phone about 5mins later and has me explain the situation, then tells me he needs to ask his manager? (ok I thought I was already talking to him) he gets back on the phone and tells me that they cant do it, but the other option is to go online and place the order. WOW AFTER ALL THAT?!? SO I go online place the fricken order, and they're late by 25mins. the pizzas were COLD! WTF?!? AND they didnt add any plates or utencils?!? ITS AN EFFING TAKE OUT ORDER DONT YOU THINK I NEED THAT SHIT?

I love the veg pizzas here. They are always perfect and yum and there is a lot of attention takent o maintian consistency. However, I think it's slightly on higher prie range and the wait can get tesdious during weekends even if you order to-go. The service is pathetic. Many of them forget what they have been told and usual have a blank apologetic expression which makes you wanna go 'dang'/duh!'

Amazing. Hawaiian and The Works are what my boyfriend and I ordered last night. So good! I always underestimate how filling pizza can be. We left with two slices of each to take home. Staff is always smiling and helpful to suggest their favorite dishes. Be sure to eat here if you're ever searching for food at Hillsdale!

It's a great alternative for eating with friends instead of the food court. I say service is a hit or miss. The food is pretty good. It seems just like any other pizza joint, but with the unique pizzas. I always lean towards getting their avocado egg rolls. If you like avocado, bacon, chicken, and cheese all covered in ranch or spicy ranch dressing...this is so the egg roll for you. I just love how they taste.  All of the other chain restaurants do no make it like California Pizza Kitchen does.  I don't know what it is, but I'm always excited to get that when I come here.
This is a great California Pizza Kitchen. The Thai Crunch Salad is simply delicious. Be sure to eat here sometime while you're shopping at HSC.
Great food typically at any location.  Sat at the bar today, great, quick service for food and drinks by the bartender.  Had the Hawaiian Pizza, which thankfully had enough pineapple for each bite.

the service was 1 star. i would give zero if it were an option.  the food was 3 stars the ambiance was 3 stars.  i would say it would be a good place to take your kids, but the wait staff was so slow that if you have impatient young children, go elsewhere.  cheescake factory is on the other side of the mall. the service is fast and the food is better.  cpk has always been one of my favorite places to eat- but the experience i had here was so awful, i may never go back.

Came and ordered a half Cesar salad with shrimp and a lemonade (I don't know why, but I love CPK lemonade!). The waiter brought me a pink drink (I assume strawberry lemonade) and I told him I asked for regular lemonade to which he responded "Do you want to try it anyways?" which I thought was kind of rude and said no.... But other than that, the salad was great and I think he felt bad because he was really great with our bread and water after that.
Been coming here for years.  Big fan of the curbside pickup option. just call in your order and drive to the parking spots across the street! absolutely love this service!

Ok I would have gave 5 stars if i didn't have a bad experience last night when my daughter called in a order so we can make a movie on time, but when i got there she said there was no order called in, so the call center made a mistake with the order and when i called back she was rude and said well i dont have anything under you name so call the restaurant manager i cant help you.  well that would have made me give 1 star but the restaurant made the order real quick and that made me feel better about coming back.

A good place to eat when out shopping but I wouldn't make a special trip. It's always busy, which isn't a bad thing but as I'm usually alone they try to push me into having lunch at the bar.  I don't like eating at a bar so every time I have to ask for a real table, then they almost always give me this horrid table next to the kitchen.  Seriously, every time.  I understand they are trying to maximize the tables but I feel like I'm being punished for not being a party of 4.  Anyway...the food is always pretty good and consistent.  The pear and gorgonzola pizza is AMAZING.  They did take my favorite dish off the menu...it was fusilli pasta with brocolli and goat cheese.  Oh well...I gave it 3 stars instead of 4 because the servers range from very good to how in the world did this person get a job as a waiter??  There is one guy who is so unhappy working there it is torture to be waited on by him.  I can tell he just wants to be anywhere else but this place and it breaks my heart.  But...sometimes I get very friendly and happy servers so it balances out.  I would recommend the management do more for employee morale.

My husband dared me. He said "When you order the sesame ginger chicken dumplings, you should ask for the ginger dumps."  When the server came by I did the ordering. My husband gave me a look like don't do it, but I went ahead and ordered the "ginger dumps." The server didn't bat an eye. He just asked if we wanted them before or with our meal. In the future I really need to make deals for something in exchange. San Mateo and Walnut Creek are the best Bay Area outposts in the CPK chain. We live in San Jose but actually went here for lunch during our day in San Mateo instead of going somewhere non-chain just because my husband misses this location. (Unlike Valley Fair, the wait's not insane.) The prices at CPK keep creeping higher and higher so now it's $25+ for two of us to share a pizza, app, and a coke. Weren't ginger dumps like $5.50 instead of $8 like 5 years ago?

It had been a few years since I last ate at a CPK and the reality of it is I just haven't had much of a palate or interest in commercial chains anymore. Well a craving for a Santa Fe pizza is what lured me here. I was craving that marinated lime chicken, guacamole, and sour cream goodness on their signature crust. Upon perusing their menu, my heart dropped after a vigorous scan turned up fruitless. They had taken it off the menu!! Grrr! I hate when that happens! Years ago, they also took off the White Tartufo which I've never ever found anywhere else. Well our very helpful and empathizing waiter Genaro tried to help  me find an equivalent. He recommended the Tostada. While it was good, it didn't really come close to my Santa Fe.  That pretty much sealed the deal for me. No reason to ever return to a CPK.

I had not been here since literally 1997, mostly because I thought the food was just okay and way overpriced. I decided I would give the place a try and man has their menu expanded. The roasted vegetable salad was delicious and the half size is more than enough. They have a couple of small plate options that were low cost and high taste. I enjoyed my experience.

1 word, pepporoni supremo.   and a chinese chicken salad.   and a barbeque chicken salad ...  and you are talking dinner... now, this is a chain...  and I usually reserve the 4 stars for non-chains... but, they are consistantly delicious...

If you're at Hillsdale Mall and you HAVE to eat, go here. Its dependable, the pizza's aren't bad, some good appetizers too, and its cheap. We pick this place over the food court EVERY time, sorry I just CAN'T eat at Sbarro anymore, I think there's an age limit or something, its just nasty. CPK has some interesting toppings, some pretty good salads too and again, its CHEAP. My niece LOVES it here so we HAVE to take her when she visits, and we don't mind.

Excellent pizza (thai chicken is my fave) and salad (walnuts, balsamic, greens, apples), fast service.  Went back an hour later to buy an iced tea to go, and got one for free.  I'll definitely go back.

Wants to be: Spago. Settles for: Crap. I can't understand why Arnold or one of his little droids up in Sacto is not protecting the integrity of the state of California and suing these people for demeaning the state by implying that this is how we here in California view pizza.

i love their pizza... they WOWED me the first time.. The mango tandoori chicken was to die for! Their chinese chicken salad is sooo good... you have to get a full size becaause the smaller one is too small... overall, great GREAT food, but the wait is kinda long...but you can call before you leave your house to make a reservation..

My friend and I were at Hillsdale mall today with a few hours to hang out, have lunch, catch up, and maybe do some shopping. We were both really hungry and ready for lunch. Our food choices included Boudin, the food court, or California Pizza Kitchen. Since Boudin is a complete rip off and I always leave hungry, we decided to take a look at CPK's menu. I normally avoid pizza places because I can't have dairy. I usually avoid chain-like establishments because of the cardboard cutout food choices as well as the overly kid friendly atmosphere. However, upon checking out the menu, I saw that in addition to pizza, pasta, and salads, that they offered my most beloved of food choices - Jambalaya. I consider myself a jambalaya snob. If it's on the menu, I just have to try it. My experiences with different restaurants have revealed that not everyone can make a decent spicy, flavorful jambalaya that satisfies a lunchtime crave. This one did.  The offering at CPK was packed with tender morsels of chicken, sausage, and shrimp nestled between a flat spaghetti-like pasta. The sauce was savory AND spicy, and generously seasoned with onions and garlic. The only warning I give is that the breath suffers as a result, so the next time I'm there, I'll make sure my husband orders the same thing. Our server was very attentive as well as cute, and the restaurant manager even came by to make sure we were doing alright, which we were. The bread and butter were decent, too, as well as plentiful.  I did have a Thai chicken cheeseless pizza there a few years back on my first visit, and it wasn't half bad. I now have a new fave rave and will happily go back when my jambalaya craving beckons.

I don't go to CPK anymore. The food is reasonably good, but not priced very reasonably given what it is. Also, they are chincy in the bread. What's up with that? They've lost me for the wrong reasons.

WHERE TO BEGIN!? how about the begining? wait is usually pretty long cause it's packed at this location... why, i'll never know. The waiter signals us to come with him to be seated... yay... we walk all the way to our table to find another party being seated at our table... WOW i've never had this happened... then we get escorted back to the front in the walk of shame... Now i'm more awestruck than pissed off.  10 minutes later we get signaled again... "are you sure?" and they are... where do we get seated? the same table... so they must have kicked the other party out? way to make a bad situation worse... so we sit down with no plates, utensils  or anything and look over the menu... order some drinks that show up after reminding our attendant a few times.... food arrives and still no utensils... i love eating salad with my fingers... even contemplated converting some straws into chopsticks....

As you can see from my other pizza reviews, I can be a bit of a pizza snob.  But I really like this place.  First, I like the fact that they offer different pizzas, as in toppings, than the normal round table or dominoes.  Second, I really dig the honey wheat crust.  And last, this is not only a pizza joint.  They have some great salads and sandwiches as well.  I think the location is good at Hillsdale as it gives shoppers another alternative than the food court and Outback.

I had to run some mall errands during my lunch hour, saw this place and figured I'd grab something quick to go. No such luck! I ordered a simple BBQ chicken chopped salad and waited FOREVER. The guy running the takeout cash register was a mess. He looked busy but he was the most inefficient person ever. My order was sitting on the counter for at least 15 minutes. I pointed it out to the woman who was waiting on the people seated at the counter, but she said she couldn't give it to me -- that the highly inefficient guy --who at that moment was hunting down cup lids for an order by a man who had been waiting there even longer than me--had to give it to me. Puh-lease! I paid for the darn thing -- just hand it over. One of the customers at the counter told me the place recently replaced its management and since then service has been shot to hell. Never going there again.

I always seem to be drawn to this place when my husband is away, and I don't want to cook for one.  I usually get a half salad - either the Thai Chicken or Chinese Chicken.  They're good, but kind of pricey for a half salad.  Who would've thought a CPK salad would be my comfort food!

this isn't necessarily a go-to, but when it's suggested, i'll oblige. i love coming here and sharing the waldorf salad and one o their many pizzas...the sicilian and bbq chicken are always good. plus, the location allows you to stuff your face, then walk it off with a shopping expedition.

A majority of my friend's hate this place since it's pretty much you're buying a personal sized pizza in which you can get a large at Domino's for the same price, lol. I love the Thai chicken, and I tried my friends' thin crust one. I forgot what it's called but it's full of meat and that is delicous. Recommend this place if you got the cash for it, very nice atmosphere for a pizza parlor.

Just had lunch there and had such bad service, I needed to Yelp them immediately.   I've always had no problems with their mediocre food but the service today was terrible.  The place was half empty so theres no explanation.  We were served our salad but no bread and we asked why?  His response was "You must request for it'  which I thought was BS for he forgot it.   If you decide to go there make sure you ask for bread with your salad.  It will be a couple months or years before I go back.
i never really had to wait for CPK at hillsdale mall. my bf and i always order the same thing -- salad and pizza. i love their honey wheat dough. yum!

Okay, so normally I have always loved CPK. Their pizzas are yummy, with great variety. Good atmosphere, and always good service. But I have got to tell you, please do not go to the one in Hillsdale Mall. I ate there yesterday and had the worst food poisoning ever. I ordered adobe chicken chowder and a salad. I thought it tasted okay, but no more than a half hour after I finished eating I was sick as a dog. I literally felt as if someone had punched me in the stomach. And I know it was their food because I hadn't eaten anything else that day besides coffee. Worst of all when I went down to tell them, not to be rude but just give them a helpful warning, they were SO RUDE TO ME. Just accept the criticism and fix your product, that's all I'm asking! Geez!

I love love love CPK.... but this is the worst managed store in their chain I have ever dined at.  We arrived at 5pm on a weekeday and taken past at least TEN unbussed tables to the back of the restaurant. We then waited too long to finally get to place our order, then an even more horrific wait to get our simple chopped salad and pizza. Iced tea glasses sat unrefreshed a good 15 minutes. Our little waiter finally arrived with some lame excuse which we couldnt understand, but he did get the manager to comp our salad due to the wait.  We noticed a considerable improvement in the staff toward the end of the meal when a very butch lady manager started making the rounds. She needs to be there 24/7 if they want to keep this place going. Never had less than a 4 star experience at other CPK locations.

After shopping for some gifts at the Mall i went to eat at the california pizza kitchen the waiting time wasn't that bad, the food was great like always but the service wasn't the best. Weekend this place is nutz but i would come back here again on the week days and not on the weekend anymore....

Bad service!  My partner, nephew and I went for lunch and two parties sat before us.  Regardless of the motivation for the poor service or table management by the hostess, it was an aweful experience and then they sent a back manager to smooth everything over...but he just insulted us.  NICE!   The food was fine but out of principle, I'de never go to that sell out restaurant again!

This is your run of the mill mall chain that i guess i shouldn't be expecting much from.  Good place for an on the go meal but obviously no where to bring someone special.  Food was ok, had the tequila chicken fettucine, which was surprisingly good, a change from the normal pasta, the crab cakes were extremely tiny for the price.  Definitely a family oriented place, for some reason this night the lights kept dimming off and on like someone leaning on the light switch, which got annoying after awhile (luckily no one had a seizure).....And I hate the seats write in the window, makes you feel like your being watched you entire meal, kinda eerie.. 8/

IF I COULD GIVE ZERO STARS I WOULD My experience started by being seated rather quickly, but that's where the good ends.  I asked for a high chair for my 2 year old and was told that I couldn't have one because of the location of the table but was offered a booster seat.  I hate booster seats.  I don't think they're safe, but after being out doing holiday shopping my son and I were both so thirsty that I took it and was carefully watching him. Our server comes over almost immediately and takes our drink order, I also order an appetizer and my son's food and was going to decide what I wanted in the mean time.  FIFTEEN MINUTES later, no drinks, no food, nothing.  Then someone else comes over and asks if we'd like something to drink.  I tell them to go ask our server about it. Next thing I know, as I'm having this conversation my son takes a head dive into the floor.  As any good mother would, I picked him up off the floor and got more tense than I've ever been in my whole life.  I demanded to see a manager.  Wildon came and offered to seat me at another table.  I told him I should be getting a free meal for what we just went through.  He said "ha, you're not getting a free meal".  I started to get really angry at that point and said something about suing CPK.  He then told me that he was going to have security remove me from the restaurant.  I told him I was going to call the police if someone laid a finger on me because my son just fell and this is not how you should treat a customer. He didn't care about the situation at all.  He just kept telling me that he had a business to run.  OK, I know that running a CPK is a super important job, and I shouldn't be so focused on the child that I spent 17 hours of labor to give birth to, but my priorities were out of whack when I noticed that my son's face was starting to bruise. Wildon walked away and I asked for them to go get him and bring him back because my son's face was bruising and I wanted him to see it.  I waited another 10 minutes and he never came.   I called the general manager this morning and was told that it's my fault for allowing my son to sit in the booster.  So it's my fault that I was mistreated.  I deserved it.  I called him a piece of shit and wished death upon him and I don't regret it at all. I'm in the process of talking to corporate and we'll see what they have to say.  I don't think I'll be back to a CPK, this location or otherwise.  I don't know that I'll buy their frozen pizzas anymore either. I guess I can give the one star to the girls working the take out register who got us some water since the whole reason we were there in the first place was because we were thirsty. I can't believe I lost a half hour of my day at this CPK.
an all time favorite of ours for years.  great place to take the kids.  in the hillsdale mall.

Tonight my family and I decided to hit up CPK for the second time together. My first experience was great, I liked the fresh tomato and spinach spaghetti. Very light and not a heavy pasta dish. Our waiter was AMAZING! Too bad I forgot his "real" name, but his name tag was Brazilian because CPK thought he could pass as one, uhm... no. Anyways! Tonight was not such a great experience, that is why I gave this place two stars. Our waiter was nice, but it seemed like she didn't really care about us. I guess I am comparing her to our previous waiter. I had the broccoli and asparagus, liked it, but didn't loooove it. DO NOT TRY THE AVOCADO + TOMATO + CHICKEN EGG ROLL! The table beside us had it and it looked appetizing. First bite into it and a burst of oil spatted out. Disgusting, right? A very heavy appetizer. On the left side of the dish on the menu it said it was a CPK favorite, don't fall for it! It's just nasty, I felt like I was just eating oil!

God this place is awful. Overpriced, poor food, bad customer service. This place is run by bozos or something. They always have the back room turned into some sort of strange hangout parlor, and in the evenings they won't sit anyone in the booths that line the wall---even in the front room! I saw them try to seat a group of six at a small table for four last time we were there, and there were multiple large booths right next to this table which they would not seat the party at "that section is closed". Fortunately the party was smart enough to simply leave. I wish we had done the same but my companion was too hungry for this to have been an option at that time. There is really nothing good I can say about this place. Not recommended.

Same friend suggested this restaurant again. It sucks because as a Mom, you get seated out in stroller land with every annoying child and stupid parent you can imagine. I was forced to discuss my infant and his stroller with every passer-by. Then I had a 20 minute conversation with a 4 year old girl at the table next to me while her mother sat there and stared off into space.  BUTTTTT: The Mac n' Cheese on the kids menu is pretty effin' good. That will be my go to dish from now on. Love the kids menu... especially when I'm broke.

The food is good. I like all the appetizers. The original bbq chicken chopped salad, and the thai chicken pizza are my favorites. Most the pizzas are good, and there's a ton to choose from, so something for everyone. However, the service is not so good. It always takes forever to get refills or ask a question. Most the servers I've had were pretty rude. Don't let me hostess sit you in the back room!!! It's where they seat large parties and families with lots of kids. It's always loud and crazy back there. Everything is a bit overpriced. They never offer any kind of deals or specials, and even though they mostly serve pizzas they don't offer a side salad. Since service sucks so much, I recommend getting a pizza to go and making a salad at home to go along with it.
Great place to bring your kids...the staff are very friendly and the food is good.

I didn't know it takes an hour to make pasta. I know we ordered appetizers but we sat there waiting around for our food for a good 40 min. Our waiter kept walking by our table and when we tired asking for anything, he would speed up and act like he didn't hear us. Totally expected better service.

It has been years since I dined here and have enjoyed the tortilla spring rolls, garlic cream feticini with chicken, and other dishes; fast forward to yesterday and aside from the prices going up, nothing has changed.  Our server, Anthony, was wonderful, leaving nothing to chance and checking back frequently, but not too much so.  the jerk chicken pizza is wonderful; a thin crust with tender spiced chicken in jerk spices, a spicy Caribbean bbq sauce, onions, and peppers.  The bread is fresh and my niece loved her chicken nugits and my mother and brother's girlfriend shared the tequila chicken feticini and loved it.  For dessert, we shared the caramel pudding with caramel, sea salt, and a light chocolate cake; very light yet sinful.  I loved the Crisp Apple Cider as it was not sweet but not much of a beer flavor either.  I love the casual yet trendy atmosphere with both traditional and creative dishes.  So, for wonderful pizza and other fare at a reasonable prices in a casual trendy atmosphere, California Pizza Kitchen cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.

This is the worst experience I have ever had at CPK. I went in for food to go on my break from work. Not only was it extremely packed and the ladies behind the counter didn't even realize I was there until I said "excuse me!" but it took more than 20 minutes just to get my food and my food wasn't hard to prepare! I ordered hummus and a cup of soup. it is not that difficult or should it take that long to give me my food when I know all you have to do is go into the soup bowl and scoop it out and pour some hummus in a to-go container. That should of only took 10 minutes max! I wasn't even able to pay for my food prior to it being ready. And one girl didn't know that I didn't even pay so I could of potentially walked out of there with free food. Thank goodness for them that I am not the type and made it clear that I didn't pay. I don't think I will ever go there again unless I've got all the time in the world to sit around and wait for them to "make" cold hummus and pour some soup. I am only giving them 2 stars because generally it never has been this bad.
I usually dine in and dash out. But I love their chicken tequila pasta and their magherita pizza. Service could improve, though.

Saddest thing I ever saw: huge group of people waiting around in the Hillsdale mall for a table at CPK on a lovely Thursday evening.  Why!?! Any restaurant on 25th Avenue, just a few blocks away would seat you right away and serve you much better food. Get the hell out of the mall!

I actually only go to CPK for their pasta dishes and appetizers, not pizza. Their fettuccine with garlic cream sauce, which you can get with chicken or shrimp and mushrooms, is my favorite. The chicken tequila fettuccine is also yummy. For appetizers, get the herb onion focaccia with checca or tortilla spring rolls. I prefer not waiting for a table, and eat at the bar instead. There are just too many families with kids running around and throwing tantrums in the dining area.

I came here for the first time the other day--I ate pizza which was good.  They have a good variety of pizzas to choose from.  I definitely want to come back to try other ones.  Good service and friendly staff.
Food is yummy, service sucks!  They are slow and don't really care.  It seems like the place is loaded with employees and no one is doing anything!   Order to go!

I've been here on numerous occasions. I think the only time i was ever WOWED by CPK was the first time I ate there. Ever since then, not so much. I tried the 2 soups in one bowl thingy today. The chicken cowder was good  and the tortilla soup sucked. I asked for a side salad with vinagrette dressing and that i got. The dressing just disgusting. I've never had a bad vinagrette. The waiter was UBBER annoying. Every 2 minutes he'd be at our table asking how we were doing. The funny thing is, with all of his concern..it took him a good 5-10 minutes to bring us lemon for our diet pepsis. Odd. Anyways..if you have to eat here, go ahead. If not please please find somewhere else to go. I (yet again) let with a BLAH feeling. Also, why was a bowl of soup, a side salad and a soda (with tip) $17?????? Oh yeah, i ate at a mall restaurant.
This place gave me food poisoning, and I had to go to urgent care.  I am never going back.

I go to this CPK all the time, and I love the food but today was a really hectic day for me I had the baby in the car coming home and thought I would use this curbside thing for the first time since I wanted to avoid getting out of the car with baby in tow.  I come to the curbside parking and there is no place to park all the spots are taken by unoccupied cars NOT waiting for curbside, I call to get my food at the time they said they said they would be out 20 min later nothing, I thought about just going it but the baby was fussy and screaming up a storm (which is why I wanted to do curbside) 2 min later I decide to leave because it wasn't worth waiting sooooo long to get my small dish I ordered. I will still go there but I don't think I will use curbside, I thought it would be faster but I guess not....and I really wanted my dish too
i like it. cool place to go for lunch w/coworkers.

CPK is a great place to get take out on a busy work week. It's close to my house, you can order in advance and they also have the option for you to park across the street, and then have them bring you your food order. This is a great options that really came in handy the weekend I was painting my living room and found myself tired, covered in paint, and hungry, all at the same time. I was able to place the order in advance and then wait in the car. The food is also pretty good for a chain restaurant. The quality is very consistent. When I order the Tostada Pizza it always tastes exactly like I expect (which is a good thing). In the past I did have trouble with my order being slightly off but that seems to have improved recently. I suggest you check your order before you leave to make sure you received all the components of your dish. Another nice feature about the drive up options is that they take all your payment info over the phone and then email you the receipt. Also once they get your number they keep email  info on file so every time I go I don't have to give the info again.

Pseudo pizza always entertaining in its "interpretation" of pizza but what really Flipping annoys me is that no matter HOW many empty tables there are there is always a Flipping 25-30 minute wait - even after asking spotty boy at the front podium "why is there a 30 minute wait when half the restaurant is empty?" to which he replied "there isn't enough wait staff" - er...freakin' hire some then, mong-head! CPK in Palo Alto is much better, if you ask me...for gawd's sake, this ain't exactly Spago...right?

They have a good Thai Crunch and Chinese Chicken Salad. I know it's a "pizza kitchen," but their pizzas aren't even all that good. I've tried three of their pizzas (Jamaican Jerk, Roasted Garlic Chicken, and The Works) and all of them weren't very good. Maybe The Works was the best one out of all, but the Jamaican Jerk didn't have much Jerk flavoring and the Roasted Garlic Chicken had more cheese than chicken; very bad thing. Oh and with the Thai Crunch salad, you could add avocado for $2.50 more and get less than half of an avocado or you could bring your own whole avocado for 79 cents. Don't laugh, I've never done it, but am highly considering it. Just a small suggestion.

We like this place. But were disappointed with thai pizza. If you are an Asian, dont try that pizza, try in thai restaurant. But the traditional pizzas were really good and it was cheaper too. Sometimes we have to wait for 30 mins or more. Worth waiting!
I don't ever bother with the pizza, I do get down with the tortilla soup and the tri color salad. other than that-HATEDDDDDDDDDDDD IT

This place has realllllllly great pizza!! Really busy all the freaking time. Service ain't bad, they give you some good bread in the beginning and they have some pretty good drinks too. Like some peach Italian soda or something. Can't wait to go back!

We ended up eating here as I threw hate on having Chinese food yet again and M balked at Japanese.  The meal was okay although M did not like her Tostada pizza. However, the reason they are getting only a single star is that there were flies all around the drinks dispenser. We had sat at the bar since the place was packed but did not notice the flies until halfway through the meal.  Upon speaking to the manager (Wildon), his response was "We know about it" with no attempt to address things. I would highly recommend that management address the lack of customer service ASAP.

I am full agreement that the wait time sucks.  But as someone who brings miniature people, ie, kids under the age of 4, California Pizza Kitchen is not such a bad place.  The 3 year old likes to play with the bread that they promptly give you, and she loves the crayons and menu.  The younger upstart likes to bang on the table and destroy the crayons.  So as a family restaurant, it's not so bad.  As an adult rating the food and such, they would earn 2 stars.  But since I'm a card carrying mom, with the mini people to prove to unbelievers, I stand by my 4 stars.  So there.

Not the greatest pizza I've ever had. The pizza was not the worst I ever had but it wasn't much. It could have been the smell of baby poop that we kept getting a whiff of or all the kids. The service was not that great.

HORRIBLE service.  Considering the fact that this place is a mall eatery we thought the wait would be long but we were seated right away.  Seated right away doesn't mean SERVED right away.  We must have sat in a half empty restaurant for 15-20 minutes (NO JOKE, we timed it) before a server appeared out of hiding.  But did this girl come to serve us? NO.  She went straight for the rich white couple that got seated 2 minutes ago.  I tried to be understanding and assume that she thought they were there first but she SAW us there when she would deliver food to guests around us.  For the 15-20 minutes that we waited she's walk past us several times with other guests' Ketchup, Food, Straws, EVERYTHING YOU COULD THINK OF without ever acknowledging us.  We stormed out of there so distraught from the horrible service i will never EVER eat there again.

i'd give this place 2.5 stars cause the service sucks here.  There is always a long wait, and once you get a table, half the menu isnt available.  Very disappointing, when you've been ready to order and once they get to you, they tell you your 3 dish selections has run out!!!  arghhhh.

OK I used to like this place for a casual and convenient lunch but after the bad service and the long wait for our food, they lost a star. I was with a really special person who deserves so much respect and while you can't go around yelling "Hey this is a living legend I'm sitting here with people! Get with it." I really wanted to! The food was just ok this time. Or maybe bad service makes your taste buds malfunction. Thanks to my awesome dining companion  (and the bad tip I convinced him to give the lame waitress) it was a wonderfully memorable time.

I always order from the same 3 items - can't break my habit - Sedona Tortilla Soup, BBQ Chopped Chicken Salad or Thai Chicken Spring Rolls.  If I eat here, I usually try to scope out a spot at the counter, cause the wait is a long time.  Often times I just get 2 of the 3 above to go.  Today's to go experience was relatively painless.  In the past it's been gut wretching at how slow the process is.
Not one of the better CPK's I have been to. Service was slow. Pizza was missing a couple of ingredients. Probably could get better pizza and service elsewhere

aww my cpk! who doesnt love you... you're good and you're at the mall.. rosemary chicken sandwich.. wow..  baja chicken rolls.. top notch... service is always 5 stars... corine is a star and my whole family loves her.. in fact she is the reason why we come there... all and all after a long hard day of shopping its good to relax and grab some cpk...
great for take out! Try the other non-pizza dishes too, some good stuff there.

My family loves this place. We come here at least once a month. Their pizzas and salads are delicious. The food and service here in the San Mateo location is outstanding. The only complaint I have with this restaurant is the long wait to be seated. It's always crowded especially on Friday nights.

Pizza was OK, wasn't the best I had, wasn't the worst either.  It is pricey though for a personal pizza.  For that price, you can probably get a full pizza for the family at another pizza restaurant.  The service was good and the had TVs around the restuarant so you can catch the game while you eat.

CPK is legit one of my favorite places to dine. Although some of the items on the menu induced some eyebrow raising from my parents, I love the fact that CPK offers so much in terms of selection. There's an item on the menu for everyone. I especially enjoy the size of the portions. This place is a little pricey, but well worth it.

damn, after coming here i think im going to have to pass on coming to CPK in NorCal  again. this was a horrible experience. the hostess who brought us to our table was either slow or just doesn't listen well. you dont need to ask how we are doing twice. about 5 seconds apart. "YOU JUST ASKED US!" but its cool whatever. after, our waiter was pretty rude. no hi, welcome or anything...just a "what do you want". are you kidding me? and the plates? omg...almost all were dirty as hell. it had left over chunks of what looked like blueberry and our beer tasted like dish washing soap. learn to wash your cups please! luckily i was still nice enough to tip...tho i shouldnt have. i loved the CPK in irvine but this place im going to have to stay away from.

if i had ever actually paid for a meal here, i might think more critically of it, but as it stands, this is where i go with my boss for a nice expense account lunch. we like to sit by the window, and i get the grilled vegetable salad and a cup of the tortilla soup with an iced tea.   it's the best free salad ever, but if i were paying for it, i'd feel a little ripped off.
yummy!!!! the food is great service it great! usually get setted quickly. if you go i reccomend jillian for a waitress she is wonderful!!!!

Okay, so it's a chain and run like one. But I think they attract great staff and the food is consistently good. I've rarely had a waitress/waiter that wasn't welcoming and fun and I always enjoy the food. It's one of the rare places where you can get really good dinner salads. And I love the pizza, although I just ordered a plain cheese pizza and I wasn't completely impressed. But that's my taste. It was cooked well and presented fine. Just not to my taste. I probably should have ordered the garlic chicken pizza, because that's my favorite. My husband and love the Tortilla soup and the Thai Crunch salads. I like their draft beers and we had some kind of strawberry smoothie thing (sorry, can't remember exactly title of the drink) recently and it was quite good. It's moderately priced, so it's not cheap, but not a bad value. But I highly recommend getting there early, before six in the evening or right before noon so you don't have to wait for so long. And during Christmas, it's a nightmare wait at peak times. But overally, we really like this place.
